alert.note: Alert for Hill County; Northern Blaine County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 19 at 2:37PM MST until January 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing precipitation expected. * WHERE...Hill County and Northern Blaine County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM MST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
